messages.message:
@sean.donohoe can we get this prioritized? I'm seeing more and more code in PRs getting in that aren't following lint rules. The longer we go without this in, the harder it's going to be to get our codebase conforming to rules again. And this was a clear regression because we did intend to have the linter in place.

cc @Ashish

I'm going to put back in a golint call (this is almost certainly not the right way to do it and it's not in a pre-merge or pre-commit hook) but at least we can start catching these when we run make test and folks will be aware they need to fix somethings. https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/69431
